item.content:encoded: Image: Rockstar Games Rockstar‚Äôs long-awaited follow-up to GTA 5 is finally coming After more than a decade, Rockstar Games will finally deliver a sequel to Grand Theft Auto 5, the open-world crime spree that has sold more than 200 million copies across multiple console generations. In 2023, GTA fans got their first official look at Grand Theft Auto 6 in the form of a teaser trailer. We already knew some details about GTA 6, after an unprecedented leak of the game in 2022, but the game‚Äôs first...

item.content:encoded: Image: Arrowhead Game Studios/Sony Interactive Entertainment A Q&A with the composer of ‚ÄòA Cup of Liber-Tea‚Äô If you look at video game composer Wilbert Roget‚Äôs credits from 2024 alone, the contrast and depth of his work is shocking. Roget composed the stirring, over-the-top songs heard when saving democracy in Helldivers 2, but also the haunting soundtrack for indie survival-via-your-car game Pacific Drive. Roget‚Äôs work will also be heard in Star Wars Outlaws later this month. Polygon asked Ro...

item.content:encoded: Image: Square Enix Pixel Cid! Pixel Chocobo! Pixel Cactuar! The Final Fantasy series has gone through several eras, and at this point, it‚Äôs been 3D longer than it hasn‚Äôt. But that first decade of Final Fantasy‚Äôs reign is also one of the most consequential in video game history. The original Final Fantasy sextet is a treasure in time, and right now you can pick up the Pixel Remasters for 20% off, with the full Final Fantasy 1-6 Pixel Remaster bundle on sale for $59.99 (was $74.99) from Nintendo...

item.title: No Man‚Äôs Sky‚Äôs new Worlds update shook up all my favorite planets | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Hello Games via Polygon Exploring the before and after No Man‚Äôs Sky is a game large enough to handle many playstyles. I could head into an Expedition and stomp bugs, explore derelict space st...
item.content:encoded: Image: Hello Games via Polygon Exploring the before and after No Man‚Äôs Sky is a game large enough to handle many playstyles. I could head into an Expedition and stomp bugs, explore derelict space stations for valuable loot, or role-play with a group of like-minded fans. But I‚Äôve always enjoyed playing No Man‚Äôs Sky as an explorer and photographer. I like to enjoy an edible, go to space, and wander around gorgeous planets taking photos. To my wonder ‚Äî and occasionally, my dismay ‚Äî the latest No ...

item.description: Photo: Hasbro Yes, it‚Äôs still a bit of a slog. But maybe you‚Äôre into that. Starting up a session of Talisman: The Magical Quest Game always seems like a great idea at first. Who wouldn‚Äôt want to eng...
item.content:encoded: Photo: Hasbro Yes, it‚Äôs still a bit of a slog. But maybe you‚Äôre into that. Starting up a session of Talisman: The Magical Quest Game always seems like a great idea at first. Who wouldn‚Äôt want to engage with a languid, high-fantasy romp of a board game with their friends? What‚Äôs the harm in spending some time with what amounts to a Hyrule- or Skyrim-inspired take on The Game of Life? Smash cut to four hours later when no one is anywhere closer to the end of the game, and I guarantee you that so...

item.title: The best video games of 2024 so far | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Capcom The best of the best, on every major platform Games are weird again! Don‚Äôt get us wrong, 2023 was an all-timer. We got new Zelda and Mario. Armored Core and Baldur‚Äôs Gate woke up from ...
item.content:encoded: Image: Capcom The best of the best, on every major platform Games are weird again! Don‚Äôt get us wrong, 2023 was an all-timer. We got new Zelda and Mario. Armored Core and Baldur‚Äôs Gate woke up from cryogenic sleep. Alan Wake rose from its plot in the Video Game IP Cemetery, while Street Fighter 6 acted like Street Fighter 5 had never happened. But while 2023 was an unforgettable year for iconic franchises, it wasn‚Äôt a surprising one. Nobody was underestimating Nintendo, FromSoftware, and Capco...

item.title: A Hollow Knight boss fight found its groove thanks to a 17th-century violinist | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Team Cherry Composer Christopher Larkin on the soundtrack‚Äôs melancholic feel In Hollow Knight, you explore a world gone to ruin, where structures are left to rot and plants and fungus reclaim...
item.content:encoded: Image: Team Cherry Composer Christopher Larkin on the soundtrack‚Äôs melancholic feel In Hollow Knight, you explore a world gone to ruin, where structures are left to rot and plants and fungus reclaim what‚Äôs left. This haunting, tragic insect kingdom ‚Äî and its unforgettable, challenging fights ‚Äî took hold in my imagination thanks to Christopher Larkin‚Äôs soundtrack. His melodies seemed to embolden prideful enemies, like during the battle against the boastful Dung Defender, or his songs would sink...

item.title: Not sure what game to play? Leave a comment, we‚Äôll help | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Graphic: Will Joel/Polygon What‚Äôs the best game to play next? We‚Äôre so glad you asked One of the coolest things about working at Polygon is recommending new, exciting games to play, whether it‚Äôs ind...
item.content:encoded: Graphic: Will Joel/Polygon What‚Äôs the best game to play next? We‚Äôre so glad you asked One of the coolest things about working at Polygon is recommending new, exciting games to play, whether it‚Äôs indie games, cozy games, board games, or just the best of the year. We‚Äôre always playing a huge variety of games ‚Äî it‚Äôs part of the job! ‚Äî so we‚Äôre able to keep you up to date on what‚Äôs what. Lists are an easy way to recommend a whole bunch of games at once, but it‚Äôs also fun to get into personal recom...
